text: You can't beat a bit of Harry Potter magic. Thanks for a great evening! #HogwartsInTheSnow https://t.co/T89GecjW67

Good news: you can be fat but fit. Less good news: but only fat-ish. http://t.co/fgKG2l5fPH
Today's Times - Quite scary when you've got a 12-year-old girl to discover that girls' confidence tends to fall sharply between 13 and 14.

Gender neutrality the big buzzword at this year's #toyfair. judging by the sea of pink craft sets, some manufacturers have yet to catch up
@SimpleSimonEmma Hi Emma could you poss follow me so I can DM you about a possible personal finance story? thanks
Turns out David Cameron and I share a Mean Parent rule: no weekend morning telly. Don't know whether to feel pleased or uneasy.
So, a survey says first-time mothers don't enjoy it till baby is six months because they don't really know what they're doing. No shit.
@parentdish_uk Termtime holidays - I'm too conformist to dare but teachers tell me they don't harm most kids. Damn. http://t.co/hIqCQE1nNF
@Jacintaz3 @sterosenthal glad I wasn't the only one.
@sterosenthal ah, thanks
Wish my office had an indoor croquet lawn. #googlemums http://t.co/5odzKV0s30
@sterosenthal is it too dim of me to ask what the beanbag holder thingy is in the goody bag?
10 minutes after #googlemums event, daughter downloaded google translate app, and did art homework on Cultural Institute. Job done.
@DrSarahB Hi, I would like to contact you for a magazine piece I'm writing. Could you possibly follow me so I can message you? Thanks v much
@emmaburgham Thanks, that's great to know. Still not sure when to let my 11-year-old daughter on Facebook, though...
@ThisisEilidh Good thanks. Too busy. But this can only be a good thing for a freelance....
@ThisisEilidh who said social media was shallow?
@ruthlewy '@timesweekend Kids are not impressed by my new supermarket regime, though: no more 'fruit' yoghurts, smoothies or cereal bars
Probably not the time to confess that when writing about the evils of sugar for @timesweekend deadline stress forced me to eat doughnuts.
It seems I am not the only mother to give up on minimum school skirt lengths. But SIX inches... .http://t.co/Xqp6thicqH
How many parents ban kids from Facebook but allow Whatsapp or Kik because we don't understand what they do? Guilty. http://t.co/acVN96EO8S

Inbox groaning with #RoyalBaby press releases- buggies, teasets, cashmere teddies. Favourite so far: the £35,000 commemorative baby monitor.
@hubmum Hi Emma, can you follow me so I can DM you? Want to quote you in a piece I'm writing on schools for the Sunday Express....thanks.
@aleunig thanks for that, it's a first - I've never appeared in an Australian publication before.
@SueHall94 hey, thanks so much. I have been making my kids sit bolt upright ever since.....
@hollyseddon doesn't mean I've told my kids that, obviously....
Survey says today's kids save their pocket money http://t.co/hv6wEz7iA1 but is it because they're not allowed out to the shops to spend it?
RT @Kevin_Maguire: If Mrs Thatcher made Britain so great why do her kids and grandkids all live abroad?
@hollyseddon it really does make a difference to sleep, I am quite taken aback.
The trouble with not allowing your kids to take gadgets to bed @hollyseddon is that you have to abide by it yourself http://t.co/BLqteSDUWL
@CamillaLeask hi, sure, if you follow me I'll DM it to you x
Having written the 20 adventures to have with your kids in the Times today, kids have pointed out I now have to make them a go-kart. Jeez.
@FatLossChef thanks. It made me look at pasta in a whole new light.
@AllTerrainKart thanks. That looks somewhat more professional than what I was proposing....
@BearGrylls might you follow me so I can dm you? There's a Times feature I'm writing you'd be good on. Thanks.
@Henry_Leon any chance you could follow me so I can DM you? writing interesting piece for the Times you'd be good on
@toadmeister  perhaps you might tackle the 'number sentence' next? On child no 2 at primary school and still trying to work out what it is.
RT @gilescoren: Chinua Achebe is dead. He was a giant. Anthills of the Savannah was the first African novel I read. Like Orwell but funn ...
@Henry_Leon You're not going to say it was character-building, are you? Mind you, I still like liver. Just not cooked like that.
@Henry_Leon @BBCWomansHour old boots levels of tough.
@BBCWomansHour @henry_Leon liver and onions, followed by Manchester tart. Can you imagine getting away with that menu for our kids?
For those of us who can't manage to live a Sheryl Sandberg life, this is heartening (via @KJDellAntonia) http://t.co/lNxGNvNlnF
I know I'm supposed to admire all-round uber-woman Sheryl Sandberg but I just feel like a lie-down. http://t.co/2pmNlwKPas
Finally understand the 6-yr-old's witterings about the vagaries of Chima thanks @legolandwindsor. #Chima4Dmovie - kids' verdict: awesome
I like the survey out today which says a mother would get £31,500 a year if she got paid.Will now think of ways to spend my imaginary salary
My children must be at the only school in Britain that doesn't dress up for #WorldBookDay. Was always grateful, but now feel a bit left out.
RT @KJDellAntonia: Just finished "Good Prose" from T. Kidder and R. Todd. Loved it, until they decree that "parent" can't be a verb. #so ...
@SarahVine I've told mine (10) when she can spell. Which might be a while.
So childhood ends at 12 @Netmums. But I don't think you're a true adult till you plump up your cushions before bed. http://t.co/WEyu2iN7Jv
Proper boredom for kids was when your mum shoved you outside to play and locked the back door behind you. Well, it was 1975.  #youandyours
good R4 debate on the benefits of kids being bored #youandyours. But @rosiemillard is right - not if their default position is the XBox.
@katewilsonart yes we got first choice, phew
@olivierwilliams They said evening, which to me means after midday. So, about 12 times so far. They'd better do it before beer o'clock.
Waiting for the outcome of your child's secondary school application on Offer Day: a peculiar form of torture. Probably worse than waxing.
Never realised how easy it was to save a life before writing the A-Z of Children's First Aid supplement for S Mag, Sunday Express today.
Learned today that for a toy to sell in the UK for £9.99, it has to be made and shipped from China for £3.50 max. No wonder bits fall off.
Written about how to avoid homework meltdowns in today's @timesweekend. Shamelessly tested on daughter - it works, thanks @calmerparenting
Favourite toy from #toyfair13 - samsam bubbleman's wands: enclose someone in a giant bubble. Simple pleasures...
Surprising news from #toyfair13 - toy sales for kids aged 6-11 are rising, not falling.  Are older kids are still playing after all?
Just met a woman who finally had a baby after 10 failed IVFs. Inspirational stuff at @zita_west book launch.
